channel.title: Extinct on ZooBerry
channel.description: Recent content in Extinct on ZooBerry

item.title: Fenris Wolf
item.description: This dark, mythical wolf will frighten and amaze your guests, perfect for Halloween zoos.

item.title: Woolly Rhinoceros
item.description: A large extinct mammal from Eurasia, primarily compatible with Snow and Boreal Forest biomes.

item.title: Ichthyosaurus
item.description: The ICHTHYOSAURUS is a marine lizard from Early Jurassic era. It almost resembles a dolphin but the tail is vertical and it has a big sclerotic ring around its eyes.

item.title: Archaeopteryx
item.description: This download adds the Archaeopteryx to your Zoo Tycoon 2 game.

item.title: Aliwalia
item.description: This huge carnivore will eat meat and fish. It can bring down small or large prey and could reach length of twelve metres.

item.title: Toxodon
item.description: Toxodon (‘Archer’s bow teeth’) is a large genus of extinct South American ungulate, ecologically similar to the hippopotamus.

item.title: Yunnan White-Handed Gibbon
item.description: This Yunnan white-handed gibbon was a subspecies of the lar gibbon located in the Yunnan province of China.

item.title: Laughing Owl
item.description: The South Island laughing owl was an endemic owl that inbabited the South Island and Stewart Islands from New Zealand.

item.title: Colossochelys
item.description: Colossochelys atlas was the biggest tortoise of all time. It has a juvenile stage. Babies and juveniles will move in herds.

item.title: Dacentrurus
item.description: The Dacentrurus was a weird-looking herbivore living in Europe. One of the largest stegosaurs, it both grazed and browsed.

item.title: Mourasuchus
item.description: A gentle giant, this beautiful yet lethargic reptile cruised the Miocene rivers, filtering plankton and shrimp through its teeth.

item.title: Pinacosaurus
item.description: Pinacosaurus (plank lizard) is a genus of medium-sized ankylosaur dinosaurs that lived in Mongolia and China.

item.title: Pterodaustro
item.description: Pterodaustro (meaning southern wing) was a Cretaceous pterosaur from South America, living 140 million years ago.

item.title: Scipionyx
item.description: Scipionyx, often informally called Sippy, was significant because it was one of the few baby dinosaurs to be preserved.

item.title: Passenger Pigeon
item.description: The passenger pigeon is an extinct species of pigeon that once was the most common in North America.

item.title: Wooly Mammoth
item.description: Mammoth remains have been found in Europe, Africa, Asia, and North America.

item.title: Tarpan
item.description: The Tarpan is a prehistoric wild horse type that ranged from Southern France and Spain eastward to central and southern Russia and into nothern China.

item.title: European Lion
item.description: Due to their remote extinction, little is known about this subspecies of lion.

item.title: The Lost World Velociraptor
item.description: The vicious film raptor as it appeared in 1997’s The Lost World.

item.title: Barbary Lion
item.description: Featuring juvenile stages!

item.title: Dwarf Panda
item.description: An extinct version of the giant panda, about half its size.

item.title: Dire Wolf
item.description: Summary of the Nile Monitor project

item.title: Platyhystrix
item.description: Platyhystrix, a little-known sailbacked amphibian from the permian, is now adoptable for your zoos!

item.title: Sarcosuchus
item.description: Sarcosuchus was a giant crocodilian.
